gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: NSIDC DAAC > National Snow and Ice Data Center DAAC

gmd:metadataStandardName.gco:CharacterString: ISO 19115-2 Geographic information - Metadata - Part 2: Extensions for imagery and gridded data

gco:Record.gco:CharacterString: SMAP Fixed Earth Grids, SMAP Science Document no: 033, May 11, 2009

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: A Universally Unique Identifier (UUID)
The ECS Short Name
The ECS Version ID

gmd:otherCitationDetails.gco:CharacterString: The Near Real Time Version of the SMAP Level 2 Passive Soil Moisture Science Processing Software.

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: Passive soil moisture estimates onto a 36-km global Earth-fixed grid, based on radiometer measurements acquired when the SMAP spacecraft is travelling from North to South at approximately 6:00 AM local time.

gmd:purpose.gco:CharacterString: The SMAP L2_SM_P effort provides soil moistures based on radiometer data on a 36 km grid.

gmd:credit.gco:CharacterString: The software that generates the Level 2 Passive Soil Moisture product and the data system that automates its production were designed and implemented at the Jet Propulsion Laboratory, California Institute of Technology in Pasadena, California.

gmd:otherCitationDetails.gco:CharacterString: An ASCII product that contains statistical information on data product results. These statistics enable data producers and users to assess the quality of the data in the data product granule.

gmd:environmentDescription.gco:CharacterString: Data product generated by the SMAP mission in HDF5 format with metadata that conforms to the ISO 19115 model.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: Soil moistures retrieved from brightness temperatures recorded by the SMAP radiometer over land targets on the descending (AM) SMAP half-orbits when the SMAP spacecraft is travelling from North to South, while the SMAP instruments are operating in the nominal mode. Retrievals are performed but flagged as questionable over urban areas, mountainous areas with high elevation variability, and areas with high ( > 5 kg/m**2) vegetation water content; for retrievals using the high-resolution radar, cells in the nadir region are also flagged. Retrievals are inhibited for permanent snow/ice, frozen ground, and excessive static or transient open water in the cell, and for excessive RFI in the sensor data.

gmd:measureDescription.gco:CharacterString: Percentage of EASE2 grid cells that lack soil moisture retrieval values relative to the total number of grid cells where soil moisture retrieval was attempted.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: Soil moisture retrieved using default retrieval algorithm from brightness temperatures acquired by the SMAP radiometer during the spacecraft descending pass.

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: Soil Moisture Active Passive Mission (SMAP) Science Data System (SDS) Operations Facility

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: Algorithm Theoretical Basis Document: SMAP L2 and L3 Radiometer Soil Moisture (Passive) Data Products: L2_SM_P & L3_SM_P
Soil Moisture Active Passive (SMAP) Radiometer processing algorithm

gmi:description.gco:CharacterString: Soil moisture retrieval is obtained using the H-polarized TB and other ancillary data. Other option algorithms exist that use a combinarion of V- and/or H-polarized TBs for soil moisture retrieval.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: Algorithm Theoretical Basis Document: SMAP L2 and L3 Radiometer Soil Moisture (Passive) Data Products: L2_SM_P & L3_SM_P

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: Database that specifies representative fractions of sand that are found in each of the 3 km cells in the cylindrical Equal-Area Scalable Earth (EASE) Grid.
Database that specifies representative fractions of water that are found in each of the 3 km cells in the cylindrical Equal-Area Scalable Earth (EASE) Grid.
Provides the Euclidean distance at each grid point to the nearest significant water body.
Database that specifies representative fractions of clay that are found in each of the 3 km cells in the cylindrical Equal-Area Scalable Earth (EASE) Grid.

Database that specifies the fraction of permanent water found in each of the 36 km cells in the cylindrical Equal-Area Scalable (EASE) Earth Grid. This data set was derived from the MODIS MOD44W data product.

Predominant land cover types that appear in each of the 3 km cells in the cylindrical Earth Equal-Area Scalable (EASE) Grid. Land cover classes are based on those recommended by the International Geosphere-Biosphere Programme (IGBP).
A configuration file that lists the entire content of the output Level 2 Passive Soil Moisture product.

The SMAP Level 1C_TB product provides radiometer brightness temperatures in half-orbit granules, gridded at 36 km grid resolution, on 3 EASE2 Earth-fixed grids - 1) Cylindrical projection, 2) Northern polar projection, 3) Southern polar projection.
A Digital Object Identifier (DOI) that provides a persistent interoperable means to locate the SMAP Radiometer Level 1C (L1C_TB) data product.
A short name employed by the Soil Moisture Active Passive mission to identify the Level 1C Radiometer product.
A configuration file that specifies the source of the values for each of the data elements that comprise the metadata in the output Level 2 Passive Soil Moisture Product.

Representative soil temperature for each of the 9 km cells in the cylindrical Earth Equal-Area Scalable (EASE) Grid at approximately the same time that the SMAP radiometer data were acquired. These data are based on the GEOS-5.7.2 TSURF data product generated by the Global Modeling and Assimilation (GMAO) office at the NASA Goddard Space Flight Center (GSFC).

Representative soil temperature for each of the 9 km cells in the cylindrical Earth Equal-Area Scalable (EASE) Grid at approximately the same time that the SMAP radiometer data were acquired. These data are based on the GEOS-5.7.2 TSURF data product generated by the Global Modeling and Assimilation (GMAO) office at the NASA Goddard Space Flight Center (GSFC).

Representative soil temperature for each of the 9 km cells in the cylindrical Earth Equal-Area Scalable (EASE) Grid at approximately the same time that the SMAP radiometer data were acquired. These data are based on the GEOS-5.7.2 TSURF data product generated by the Global Modeling and Assimilation (GMAO) office at the NASA Goddard Space Flight Center (GSFC).

The SMAP Level 1C_TB product provides radiometer brightness temperatures in half-orbit granules, gridded at 36 km grid resolution, on 3 EASE2 Earth-fixed grids - 1) Cylindrical projection, 2) Northern polar projection, 3) Southern polar projection.
A Digital Object Identifier (DOI) that provides a persistent interoperable means to locate the SMAP Active Level 2 Soil Moisture (L2_SM_A) data product.
A short name employed by the Soil Moisture Active Passive mission to identify the Active Level 2 Soil Moisture product.

A configuration file that specifies the complete set of elements within the input SMAP L2_SM_A Product that the Level 2 Passive Soil Moisture Science Processing Software (SPS) needs in order to function.

A configuration file that specifies the complete set of elements within the input SMAP L1C Radiometer Product that the Level 2 Passive Soil Moisture Science Processing Software (SPS) needs in order to function.

Database that specifies a representative value of Normalized Difference Vegetation Index (NDVI) for each of the 3 km cells in the cylindrical Equal-Area Scalable Earth (EASE) Grid. The dataset was processed by USDA from the MODIS MOD13A2 data product.
Snow fraction data resampled to 9 km grid spacing on the cylindrical Earth Equal-Area Scalable (EASE) Grid, derived from daily NOAA IMS snow cover data.

Representative surface slope data for each of the 36 km cells in the cylindrical Earth Equal-Area Scalable (EASE) Grid. These data are based on the Global Multi-resolution Terrain Elevation 2010 (GMTED2010) data set provided by the United States Geological Service (USGS).

Representative precipitation measures for each of the 9 km cells in the cylindrical Earth Equal-Area Scalable (EASE) Grid at approximately the same time that the SMAP radiometer data were acquired. These data are based on the GEOS-5.7.2 PRECTOT data product generated by the Global Modeling and Assimilation (GMAO) office at the NASA Goddard Space Flight Center (GSFC).

Predominant land cover types that appear in each of the 36 km cells in the cylindrical Earth Equal-Area Scalable (EASE) Grid. Land cover classes are based on those recommended by the International Geosphere-Biosphere Programme (IGBP). The data set lists multiple predominant land cover types within each 36 km cell, along with an estimated fraction of the cell covered by each predominant type.

Representative fraction of each of the 3 km cells in the cylindrical Earth Equal-Area Scalable (EASE) Grid that is covered by Urban Area. These data are based on the Global Urban-Rural Mapping Project (GRUMP) conducted by the Center for International Earth Science Information Network (CIESUN) at Columbia University.

The Surface ROUGHNESS_COEFF Coefficient file contains the RMS ROUGHNESS_COEFF in cm for each 3 km grid cell on the cylindrical Earth Equal-Area Scalable (EASE) grid. ROUGHNESS_COEFF data is in the physical unit of &#8220;cm&#8221;; and a scale factor of 10 is used to convert into unit-less coefficients. This is a static map based on MODIS IGBP land cover map.
Database that specifies representative bulk density that is found in each of the 3 km cells in the cylindrical Equal-Area Scalable Earth (EASE) Grid.

Predominant land cover types that appear in each of the 36 km cells in the cylindrical Earth Equal-Area Scalable (EASE) Grid. Land cover classes are based on those recommended by the International Geosphere-Biosphere Programme (IGBP). The data set lists multiple predominant land cover types within each 36 km cell, along with an estimated fraction of the cell covered by each predominant type.

A configuration file generated automatically within the SMAP data system that specifies all of the conditions required for each individual run of the Level 2 Passive Soil Moisture Software Processing Software (SPS).

Database that specifies a representative value of Normalized Difference Vegetation Index (NDVI) for each of the 36 km cells in the cylindrical Equal-Area Scalable Earth (EASE) Grid. The dataset was processed by USDA from the MODIS MOD13A2 data product.

gmi:description.gco:CharacterString: The SMAP observatory houses an L-band radiometer that operates at 1.414 GHz and an L-band radar that operates at 1.225 GHz. The instruments share a rotating reflector antenna with a 6 meter aperture that scans over a 1000 km swath. The bus is a 3 axis stabilized spacecraft that provides momentum compensation for the rotating antenna.
The SMAP 1.225 GHz L-Band Radar Instrument
